Class Pedestrian

java.lang.Object
LayeredObject
SimulationObject
AnimateObject
Pedestrian
public class Pedestrian extends AnimateObject
This is the template for Pedestrian objects, which "walk" around the environment.

    • Pedestrian

      public Pedestrian(String i, double speed, int x, int y, int localLayer)
      Class constructor.
      Parameters:
      i - Identifier
      speed - The pedestrian's speed
      x - The pedestrian's x-position
      y - The pedestrian's y-position
      localLayer - The pedestrian's local layer

  • Method Details

    • closeEnough

      private boolean closeEnough(int[] target, int[] point)
      Determines if a point is within a certain range of the target
      Parameters:
      target - The coordinates of the target (any object)
      point - The coordinates of a certain point
      Returns:
      a boolean value that indicates if the point is within a certain range of the target

    • isExitable1

      private String isExitable1()
      Checks if the current position of this object is an exit. This is used in Level 1.
      Returns:
      Null if it is not an exit or exitable, or The type of exit: "left", "up", "right" or "down"

    • isExitable2

      private String isExitable2()
      Checks if the current position of this object is an exit. This is used in Level 2.
      Returns:
      Null if it is not an exit or exitable, or The type of exit: "left", "up", "right" or "down"

    • decideDestination1

      public void decideDestination1()
      Finds the pedestrian's next destination. This is used in Level 1.

    • decideDestination2

      Finds the pedestrian's next destination. This is used in Level 2.

    • decideDestination

      public void decideDestination()
      Finds the pedestrian's next destination according to the level the program is on.
      Specified by:
      decideDestination in class AnimateObject

    • onSameDirection

      private boolean onSameDirection(int direction, int y, int x)
      Checks if the next destination is on the same direction as the direction this object is facing.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction the object is facing
      y - Vertical distance
      x - Horizontal distance
      Returns:
      a boolean value indicating if the next destination is on the same direction as the direction this object is facing.

    • draw

      Specified by:
      draw in class LayeredObject
      Parameters:
      g - Graphics used to draw this object

    • getCoordinates

      public static int[][] getCoordinates()
      Get the available coordinates according to the level the program is on, which may come in handy when spawning pedestrians.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of all coordinates the object can go to in a certain level.
